topics.title: SigmaQuest Game Introduction and Acknowledgments
topics.summary: Timer introduces SigmaQuest as his first ErgoHack submission and first coding project. He thanks contributors Mark the Shark, CA, and Claude for helping, emphasizing his beginner status but pride in the project.

topics.title: Prize Structure and Honeypot Wallet Mechanics
topics.summary: Timer explains the 200 ERG prize pool and wallet mechanics. Winners collect seed words throughout gameplay to restore the honeypot wallet in Nautilus, with each game costing 10 ERG to play.

topics.title: Game One: AI Cryopod Escape Challenge
topics.summary: The first game involves conversing with AI to escape a cryopod by discovering a password containing five seed words in correct order. Players interact through chat to solve logic puzzles.

topics.title: Game Two: AI-Enhanced Oregon Trail Ship Escape
topics.summary: The second game resembles Oregon Trail with predetermined paths but uses Claude AI to generate creative death scenarios for wrong choices. Players navigate ship escape routes with narrative consequences for failures.

topics.title: Game Three: AI-Judged Space Challenges and Final Boss
topics.summary: The final game combines elements from previous games with AI-judged open-ended challenges in space. Features a dynamic final boss that generates new questions each time, with answers being seed words.

topics.title: Game Economics and Competition Structure
topics.summary: Timer outlines the competitive race format where multiple players contribute 30 ERG each for full gameplay, potentially creating a large prize pool. He expresses hope that the games provide appropriate difficulty.

topics.title: Code Documentation and Educational Resources
topics.summary: Timer showcases his GitHub repository with comprehensive documentation designed for beginners. Includes developer overview, API setup instructions, and server commands to help others build similar projects.

topics.title: Development Journey and Future Building Plans
topics.summary: Timer reflects on his learning experience, noting the project was longer than expected but increased his coding knowledge tenfold. He expresses excitement about continuing to build on Ergo blockchain.
